definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You will have to fasten the lid down with nails .
sentences.chinese: 你必须用钉子把盖子钉牢。

sentences.english: We have a cover to prevent evaporation.
sentences.chinese: 我们有一个盖子防止水蒸发。

sentences.english: The cup with a cover is li leis .
sentences.chinese: 那个带盖子的杯子是李雷的。

sentences.english: This top fits over the bottle and keeps the teat sterile .
sentences.chinese: 这个盖子严实地盖在奶瓶上，保持奶嘴无菌。

sentences.english: Close the lid and turn the knob to pork cooking cycle to stew about 15 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 盖上盖子，调至肉类档位焖煮大约15分钟。

sentences.english: Put the cap back on the toothpaste.
sentences.chinese: 把盖子重新拧在牙膏管上。

sentences.english: For most newer vehicles, turn the cap until you hear it click three times.
sentences.chinese: 对于新汽车来说，拧紧盖子，直至听到响三下。

sentences.english: Now we will create two half-spheres as the eye lids.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们将创建两个半领域的眼睛盖子。

sentences.english: What's wrong with the distributor is that the distributor cap is cracked.
sentences.chinese: 配电器的毛病，就是出在盖子破裂了。

sentences.english: Release the cap with hand in counterclockwise direction.
sentences.chinese: 用手朝逆时针方向松动盖子。

sentences.english: It has a cap that makes a satisfying click sound when it's shut.
sentences.chinese: 它有个盖子当关上时可以产生一确信的喀嚓声。

sentences.english: The lid shut with a snap.
He took the cover off the font , and put his white gloves in it.
sentences.chinese: 他揭开圣水器的盖子，把自己的白手套放了进去。

sentences.english: Dedicated to after the aluminum foil sealing, to tight the loosen lid again.
sentences.chinese: 专用于铝箔封口后，再次给松动的盖子旋紧。

sentences.english: Tip jar with lid on to shift product into sifter.
sentences.chinese: 提示罐子的盖子上改变产品的筛子。

sentences.english: Employee got his toe caught in a vent cover.
sentences.chinese: 被通气孔的盖子卡伤了脚趾头。

definition: to unscrew/to twist off (a lid)/to turn on (a faucet)/to switch on (by turning a knob)/to turn (a door handle)/to wrench apart
to close up/to heal (of wound)/to keep one's lips sealed
see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
